document.heading: Genetic Tests for the Establishment of Paternity Amendment Temporary Act of 1989

history.narrative: Law 8-72, the “Genetic Tests for the Establishment of Paternity Amendment Temporary Act of 1989,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-429. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on October 24, 1989, and November 7, 1989, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on November 13, 1989, it was assigned Act No. 8-111 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 8-72 became effective on March 8, 1990.

meta.search-text: ENROLLMENT(S) kwiktag ® 103 204 189 COUNCIIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NOTICE D.C. LAW 8-72 "Genetic Tests for the Establishment of Paternity Amendment Temporary Act of 1989 Pursuant to Section 412 of the District of Columbia Self- Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, P. L. 93-198 the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. 8-429 on first and second readings, October 24, 1989, and November 7, 1989, respectively. Following the signature of the Mayor on November 13, 1989, this legislation was assigned Act No. 8-111, published in the November 24, 1989, edition of the D.C. Register Vol. 36 page 8008) and transmitted to Congress on November 16, 1989 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(I) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that the 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C. Law 8-72, effective March 8, 1990. I D A LA~R~’ DA chVairman of the Council Dates Counted During the 30-day Congressional Review Period: November January February March 16,17,20,21,22 23,24,25,26,29,30,31 1,2,5,6,7,8,20,21,22,23,26,27,28 1,2,5,6,7 I).C. 8 MAR 0 8 1990 AN ACT Codification District of Columbia Code (1990 Supplement) D.C. ACT 8 -1 1 I IN THE COUB.ICIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NOV 9 To amend, on a temporary basis, Title 16 of the District of Columbia Code to require a person to submit to a genetic test if requested by a party and to clarify that a genetic test must be admitted into evidence even if a party objects to the introduction, unless there is substantiated objection that the test did not comply with prescribed requirements. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cit.ed as the "Genetic Tests for the Establishment of Paternity Amendment Temporary Act of 1989" Sec. 2. Title 16 of the District of Columbia Code is amended as follows a) Section 16.-23~3(a)(]) is amended by striking the phrase "or on the motion of a party, may require" and inserting the phrase "may require, or on the motion of a party, shall require" in its place; and (b) Section 16-234:3.1(a) is amended as follows I) Paragraph (I) is amended by striking the phrase "Test results or expert reports" and inserting the phrase "Expert reports that show" in its place; and (2) A new paragraph (3) is added to read as follows 3) Test results that show the statistical probability of ~the alleged parent’s paternity shall be admitted into evidence unless a. substantiated objection is made that the test did not comply with the requirements of this subchapter Sec. 3 a) ’]This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as provided in section 602(c)(I) of the District of Columbia Note, 1-229 16-2343 16-2343.1 Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 2 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C.
